message: @mko observed this last night while we were both using Convore and IM'ing as well, and ever since he mentioned that I've been noticing it as well, and how little value this information adds, versus the info I'm looking for: who last posted in a group?
…by which I mean it has a very big focus on who created something, rather than who last contributed to something. ;)
Same for groups, actually. I really don't care so much who created a group (on the group overview), but I would love to know who last posted in it, not just when "someone" did.
because I feel like it's not that important
yeah, I really dislike showing who created the group
I'd rather just see the admins... or make the group the focus, not the creator

@KuraFire well, it might be nice for a person joining that group to get a sense that, yes, this celebrity really is on the site... but i don't know if that's really a use case convore is considering or wanting to pursue

@djchall Showing them as creators of topics/groups seems unnecessary, though. Especially if (as I suggested in another thread) Convore does what Quora does and shows a user's recent [public] activity on their profile page
@leah i could see celebrities wanting to use convore to interact with their fans
